title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: addtion following code conduct, please also refer rOpenSci’s Code Conduct.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement rabutler@usbr.gov. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to prism
text: outlines propose change prism.

title: Contributing to prism
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to prism
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). Bigger changes also include new tests, appropriate.

title: Contributing to prism
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("ropensci/prism", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html. GitHub Action Builds must pass

title: Contributing to prism
text: New code generally follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to prism
text: Please note prism project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Download and plot PRISM data
text: prism available CRAN: development version can installed GitHub devtools:
code: install.packages("prism") # install.packages("devtools") library(devtools) install_github("ropensci/prism")

title: Download and plot PRISM data
text: overall work flow prism package (links go details page): Set download directory, .e., folder computer prism data saved : prism_set_dl_dir(). now referred “prism archive”. Download prism data archive: get_prism_*(). folder, variable, timestep, day/month/year stored single folder archive referred prism data (pd). Interact prism archive: prism_archive_*(). interact prism data: pd_*(). remainder README provides examples following work flow.

title: Download and plot PRISM data
text: Data available 4 different temporal scales mentioned . temporal scale, 7 different parameters/variables available. Keep mind modeled parameters, measured. Please see full description calculated.

title: Download and plot PRISM data
text: downloading data, set directory prism data saved : now referred “prism archive”. prism_archive_*() functions allow user search archive. prism archive contains “prism data”. prism data referred folder names, even though “real” data .bil, .txt, files exist folder. prism data (pd) can accessed using pd_*() functions.
code: library(prism) prism_set_dl_dir("~/prismtmp")

title: Download and plot PRISM data
text: Normals based latest 30-year period; currently 1981 - 2010. Normals can downloaded two resolutions, 4km 800m, resolution must specified. can downloaded given month, vector months, annual averages 30 years. archive already set, calling get_prism_*() functions prompt user specify directory. prism data downloaded zip files unzipped. keepZip argument TRUE zip file remain machine, otherwise automatically deleted.
code: # Download the January - June 30-year averages at 4km resolution get_prism_normals(type="tmean", resolution = "4km", mon = 1:6, keepZip = FALSE)  # Download the 30-year annual average precip and annual average temperature get_prism_normals("ppt", "4km", annual = TRUE, keepZip = FALSE) get_prism_normals("tmean", "4km", annual = TRUE, keepZip = FALSE)

what: Download daily, monthly, and annual data
title: Download and plot PRISM data
text: Let us download daily average temperatures June 1 June 14, 2013. can also download January average temperature data 1982 2014. Finally, download annual average precipitation 2000 2015. Note daily data need give well formed date string form “YYYY-MM-DD”.
code: get_prism_dailys(   type = "tmean",    minDate = "2013-06-01",    maxDate = "2013-06-14",    keepZip = FALSE ) get_prism_monthlys(type = "tmean", year = 1982:2014, mon = 1, keepZip = FALSE) get_prism_annual("ppt", years = 2000:2015, keepZip = FALSE)

what: Interact with the archive and prism data
title: Download and plot PRISM data
text: can view prism data downloaded simple command: prism_archive_ls(). function gives list folder names, .e., prism data (pd). functions prism package work one folder names (pd). prism functions use folder format, files may need absolute path (e.g. raster package). pd_to_file() function conveniently returns absolute path. Alternatively, may want see normal name product (file name), can get pd_get_name() function. Finally, prism_archive_subset() convenient way search specific parameters, time steps, days, months, years, ranges days, months, years.
code: ## Truncated to keep file list short prism_archive_ls() ## Truncated to keep file list short pd_to_file(prism_archive_ls())  pd_get_name(prism_archive_ls()) # we know we have downloaded June 2013 daily data, so lets search for those  prism_archive_subset("tmean", "daily", mon = 6)  # or we can look for days between June 7 and June 10 prism_archive_subset(   "tmean", "daily", minDate = "2013-06-07", maxDate = "2013-06-10" )

previous_headings: Interact with the archive and prism data
title: Download and plot PRISM data
text: can easily make quick plot data using output prism_archive_ls() prism_archive_subset() pd_image(). easy load prism data raster package. time look January temperature anomalies. examine difference January 2013 January 30-year normals. Conveniently, already downloaded data. just need grab archive. plot shows January 2013 warmer average last 30 years. also shows easy use raster library work prism data. package provides simple framework work large number rasters can easily download visualize use data sets.
code: # Plot the January 30-year average temperatures # grab only the first value, just in case multiple values are returned jmean <- prism_archive_subset(   "tmean", "monthly normals", mon = 1, resolution = "4km" ) pd_image(jmean) library(raster) # knowing the name of the files you are after allows you to find them in the  # list of all files that exist # jnorm_name <- "PRISM_tmean_30yr_normal_4kmM2_01_bil" # j2013_name <- "PRISM_tmean_stable_4kmM3_201301_bil" # but we will use prism_archive_subset() to find the files we need  jnorm <- prism_archive_subset(   "tmean", "monthly normals", mon = 1, resolution = "4km" ) j2013 <- prism_archive_subset("tmean", "monthly", years = 2013, mon = 1)  # raster needs a full path, not the "short" prism data name jnorm <- pd_to_file(jnorm) j2013 <- pd_to_file(j2013)  ## Now we'll load the rasters. jnorm_rast <- raster(jnorm) j2013_rast <- raster(j2013)  # Now we can do simple subtraction to get the anomaly by subtracting 2014  # from the 30 year normal map anomCalc <- function(x, y) {   return(x - y) }  anom_rast <- raster::overlay(j2013_rast,jnorm_rast,fun = anomCalc)  plot(anom_rast)

previous_headings: Interact with the archive and prism data
title: Download and plot PRISM data
text: can also visualize single point across multiple prism data files (slice) using pd_plot_slice(). procedure take set rasters, create “raster::stack”, extract data point, create ggplot2 object. Let’s now make plot January temperatures Boulder 1982 2014. First ’ll grab data US (downloaded previous step), give function point get data . point must vector form longitude, latitude. pd_plot_slice() returns gg object, can combined ggplot functions.
code: library(ggplot2) # data already exist in the prism dl dir boulder <- c(-105.2797, 40.0176)  # prism_archive_subset() will return prism data that matches the specified  # variable, time step, years, months, days, etc. to_slice <- prism_archive_subset("tmean", "monthly", mon = 1) p <- pd_plot_slice(to_slice, boulder)  # add a linear average and title p +    stat_smooth(method="lm", se = FALSE) +    theme_bw() +    ggtitle("Average January temperature in Boulder, CO 1982-2014")

previous_headings: Interact with the archive and prism data
title: Download and plot PRISM data
text: Finally, prism data form can used leaflet maps (help raster package). leaflet package allows easily make JavaScript maps using leaflet mapping framework using prism data. can easily hosted websites like Rpubs site. simple example plotting 30-year normal annual temperature. run code interactive map, instead just screen shot shown . [
code: library(leaflet) library(raster) library(prism)  # 30-year normal average temperature have already been downloaded for  norm <- prism_archive_subset(   "tmean", "annual normals", resolution = "4km" ) rast <- raster(pd_to_file(norm))  # Create color palette and plot pal <- colorNumeric(   c("#0000FF", "#FFFF00", "#FF0000"),    values(rast),   na.color = "transparent" )  leaflet() %>%    addTiles(     urlTemplate = 'http://server.arcgisonline.com/ArcGIS/rest/services/World_Imagery/MapServer/tile/{z}/{y}/{x}'   ) %>%    addRasterImage(rast, colors = pal, opacity=.65) %>%    addLegend(pal = pal, values = values(rast), title = "Deg C")

title: Authors and Citation
text: Hart Edmund. Author, conceptor. Kendon Bell. Author. Alan Butler. Contributor, maintainer.

what: Access Data from the Oregon State Prism Climate Project
title: Access Data from the Oregon State Prism Climate Project
text: package allows users access visualize data Oregon State PRISM project. Data form gridded rasters continental US 4 different temporal scales: daily, monthly, annual, 30 year normals. Please see webpage full description data products, see overview.

what: Interact with the archive and prism data
title: Access Data from the Oregon State Prism Climate Project
text: can view prism data downloaded simple command: prism_archive_ls(). function gives list folder names, .e., prism data (pd). functions prism package work one folder names (pd). prism functions use folder format, files may need absolute path (e.g. raster package). pd_to_file() function conveniently returns absolute path. Alternatively, may want see normal name product (file name), can get pd_get_name() function. Finally, prism_archive_subset() convenient way search specific parameters, time steps, days, months, years, ranges days, months, years.
code: ## Truncated to keep file list short prism_archive_ls() #>   [1] "PRISM_ppt_30yr_normal_4kmM4_01_bil"       #>   [2] "PRISM_ppt_30yr_normal_4kmM4_annual_bil"   #>   [3] "PRISM_ppt_stable_4kmM2_1950_bil"          #>   [4] "PRISM_ppt_stable_4kmM2_195001_bil"        #>   [5] "PRISM_ppt_stable_4kmM2_195002_bil"        #>   [6] "PRISM_ppt_stable_4kmM2_195003_bil"        #>   [7] "PRISM_ppt_stable_4kmM2_195004_bil"        #>   [8] "PRISM_ppt_stable_4kmM2_195005_bil"        #>   [9] "PRISM_ppt_stable_4kmM2_195006_bil"        #>  [10] "PRISM_ppt_stable_4kmM2_195007_bil"        .... ## Truncated to keep file list short pd_to_file(prism_archive_ls()) #>   [1] "C:\\Users\\RAButler\\Documents\\prismtmp\\PRISM_ppt_30yr_normal_4kmM4_01_bil\\PRISM_ppt_30yr_normal_4kmM4_01_bil.bil"             #>   [2] "C:\\Users\\RAButler\\Documents\\prismtmp\\PRISM_ppt_30yr_normal_4kmM4_annual_bil\\PRISM_ppt_30yr_normal_4kmM4_annual_bil.bil"     #>   [3] "C:\\Users\\RAButler\\Documents\\prismtmp\\PRISM_ppt_stable_4kmM2_1950_bil\\PRISM_ppt_stable_4kmM2_1950_bil.bil"                   #>   [4] "C:\\Users\\RAButler\\Documents\\prismtmp\\PRISM_ppt_stable_4kmM2_195001_bil\\PRISM_ppt_stable_4kmM2_195001_bil.bil"               #>   [5] "C:\\Users\\RAButler\\Documents\\prismtmp\\PRISM_ppt_stable_4kmM2_195002_bil\\PRISM_ppt_stable_4kmM2_195002_bil.bil"               ....  pd_get_name(prism_archive_ls()) #>   [1] "Jan 30-year normals - 4km resolution - Precipitation"       #>   [2] "Annual 30-year normals - 4km resolution - Precipitation"    #>   [3] "1950 - 4km resolution - Precipitation"                      #>   [4] "Jan  1950 - 4km resolution - Precipitation"                 #>   [5] "Feb  1950 - 4km resolution - Precipitation"                 .... # we know we have downloaded June 2013 daily data, so lets search for those  prism_archive_subset("tmean", "daily", mon = 6) #>  [1] "PRISM_tmean_stable_4kmD2_20130601_bil" #>  [2] "PRISM_tmean_stable_4kmD2_20130602_bil" #>  [3] "PRISM_tmean_stable_4kmD2_20130603_bil" #>  [4] "PRISM_tmean_stable_4kmD2_20130604_bil" #>  [5] "PRISM_tmean_stable_4kmD2_20130605_bil" #>  [6] "PRISM_tmean_stable_4kmD2_20130606_bil" #>  [7] "PRISM_tmean_stable_4kmD2_20130607_bil" #>  [8] "PRISM_tmean_stable_4kmD2_20130608_bil" #>  [9] "PRISM_tmean_stable_4kmD2_20130609_bil" #> [10] "PRISM_tmean_stable_4kmD2_20130610_bil" #> [11] "PRISM_tmean_stable_4kmD2_20130611_bil" #> [12] "PRISM_tmean_stable_4kmD2_20130612_bil" #> [13] "PRISM_tmean_stable_4kmD2_20130613_bil" #> [14] "PRISM_tmean_stable_4kmD2_20130614_bil"  # or we can look for days between June 7 and June 10 prism_archive_subset(   "tmean", "daily", minDate = "2013-06-07", maxDate = "2013-06-10" ) #> [1] "PRISM_tmean_stable_4kmD2_20130607_bil" #> [2] "PRISM_tmean_stable_4kmD2_20130608_bil" #> [3] "PRISM_tmean_stable_4kmD2_20130609_bil" #> [4] "PRISM_tmean_stable_4kmD2_20130610_bil"

previous_headings: Interact with the archive and prism data
title: Access Data from the Oregon State Prism Climate Project
text: can easily make quick plot data using output prism_archive_ls() prism_archive_subset() pd_image().  easy load prism data raster package. time look January temperature anomalies. examine difference January 2013 January 30-year normals. Conveniently, already downloaded data. just need grab archive.  plot shows January 2013 warmer average last 30 years. also shows easy use raster library work prism data. package provides simple framework work large number rasters can easily download visualize use data sets.
code: # Plot the January 30-year average temperatures jmean <- prism_archive_subset(   "tmean", "monthly normals", mon = 1, resolution = "4km" ) pd_image(jmean) library(raster) #> Loading required package: sp # knowing the name of the files you are after allows you to find them in the  # list of all files that exist # jnorm_name <- "PRISM_tmean_30yr_normal_4kmM2_01_bil" # j2013_name <- "PRISM_tmean_stable_4kmM3_201301_bil" # but we will use prism_archive_subset() to find the files we need  jnorm <- prism_archive_subset(   "tmean", "monthly normals", mon = 1, resolution = "4km" ) j2013 <- prism_archive_subset("tmean", "monthly", years = 2013, mon = 1)  # raster needs a full path, not the "short" prism data name jnorm <- pd_to_file(jnorm) j2013 <- pd_to_file(j2013)  ## Now we'll load the rasters. jnorm_rast <- raster(jnorm) j2013_rast <- raster(j2013)  # Now we can do simple subtraction to get the anomaly by subtracting 2014  # from the 30 year normal map anomCalc <- function(x, y) {   return(x - y) }  anom_rast <- raster::overlay(j2013_rast,jnorm_rast,fun = anomCalc)  plot(anom_rast)

text: can also visualize single point across multiple prism data files (slice) using pd_plot_slice(). procedure take set rasters, create “raster::stack”, extract data point, create ggplot2 object. Let’s now make plot January temperatures Boulder 1982 2014. First ’ll grab data US (downloaded previous step), give function point get data . point must vector form longitude, latitude. pd_plot_slice() returns gg object, can combined ggplot functions.
code: library(ggplot2) # data already exist in the prism dl dir boulder <- c(-105.2797, 40.0176)  # prism_archive_subset() will return prism data that matches the specified  # variable, time step, years, months, days, etc. to_slice <- prism_archive_subset("tmean", "monthly", mon = 1) p <- pd_plot_slice(to_slice, boulder)  # add a linear average and title p +    stat_smooth(method="lm", se = FALSE) +    theme_bw() +    ggtitle("Average January temperature in Boulder, CO 1982-2014") #> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'

code: library(leaflet) library(raster) library(prism)  # 30-year normal average temperature have already been downloaded for  norm <- prism_archive_subset(   "tmean", "annual normals", resolution = "4km" ) rast <- raster(pd_to_file(norm))  # Create color palette and plot pal <- colorNumeric(   c("#0000FF", "#FFFF00", "#FF0000"),    values(rast),   na.color = "transparent" )  leaflet() %>%    addTiles(     urlTemplate = 'http://server.arcgisonline.com/ArcGIS/rest/services/World_Imagery/MapServer/tile/{z}/{y}/{x}'   ) %>%    addRasterImage(rast, colors = pal, opacity=.65) %>%    addLegend(pal = pal, values = values(rast), title = "Deg C")

title: Download prism data — get_prism_annual
text: Download grid cell data prism project. Temperature (min, max, mean), mean dewpoint temperature, precipitation, vapor pressure deficit (min max) can downloaded annual (get_prism_annual()), monthly (get_prism_monthlys()), daily (get_prism_dailys()), 30-year averages (get_prism_normals()). Data 4km resolution, except normals can also downloaded 800m resolution. Download data prism project 30 year normals 4km 800m grid cell resolution precipitation, mean, min max temperature

title: Download prism data — get_prism_annual
code: get_prism_annual(   type,   years,   keepZip = TRUE,   keep_pre81_months = FALSE,   service = NULL )  get_prism_dailys(   type,   minDate = NULL,   maxDate = NULL,   dates = NULL,   keepZip = TRUE,   check = "httr",   service = NULL )  get_prism_monthlys(   type,   years,   mon = 1:12,   keepZip = TRUE,   keep_pre81_months = TRUE,   service = NULL )  get_prism_normals(type, resolution, mon = NULL, annual = FALSE, keepZip = TRUE)

title: Download prism data — get_prism_annual
text: type type data download. Must "ppt", "tmean", "tmin", "tmax", "tdmean", "vpdmin", "vpdmax". Note tmean ==  mean(tmin, tmax). years valid numeric year, vector years, download data . keepZip TRUE, leave downloaded zip files 'prism.path', FALSE, deleted. keep_pre81_months pre-1981 data includes monthly data annual data specified year. need annual monthly data advantageous keep monthly data downloading annual data download zip file . downloading annual data, defaults FALSE. downloading monthly data, defaults TRUE. service Either NULL (default) URL provided PRISM staff subscription-based service. Example: "http://services.nacse.org/prism/data/subscription/800m". use subscription option, must use IP address registered PRISM staff. NULL, URL defaults : "http://services.nacse.org/prism/data/public/4km". minDate Date start downloading daily data. Must specified valid iso-8601 (e.g. YYYY-MM-DD) format. May provided either character base::Date class. maxDate Date end downloading daily data.  Must specified valid iso-8601 (e.g. YYYY-MM-DD) format. May provided either character base::Date class. dates vector dates download daily data. Must specified valid iso-8601 (e.g. YYYY-MM-DD) format. May provided either character base::Date class. check One "httr" "internal". See details. mon valid numeric month, vector months. Required get_prism_monthlys(). Can NULL get_prism_normals(). resolution spatial resolution data, must either "4km" "800m". annual TRUE download annual normals.

title: Download prism data — get_prism_annual
text: Nothing returned - error occcur download successful.

title: Download prism data — get_prism_annual
text: valid download directory must exist downloading prism data. can set using prism_set_dl_dir() can verified using prism_check_dl_dir(). check parameter, "httr", default, checks file name using web service, downloads file name file system. "internal" (much faster) attempts download layers already file system stable. "internal" used caution robust changes version file names.

title: Download prism data — get_prism_annual
text: Annual monthly prism data available 1891 present. 1891-1980 data, monthly annual data grouped together one download file; keep_pre81_months determines months/yearly data kept download.  Data downloaded specified months (mon) years supplied vectors.

title: Download prism data — get_prism_annual
text: Daily prism data available beginning January 1, 1981. download daily data, dates must proper format downloading work properly. Dates can specified using either date range via minDate maxDate, vector dates, .

title: Download prism data — get_prism_annual
text: 30-year normals currently computed using 1991-2020 available 4km 800m resolution. See https://prism.nacse.org/normals/. mon specified annual TRUE, monthly annual normal data downloaded.

title: Download prism data — get_prism_annual
code: if (FALSE) { # Get all annual average temperature data from 1990 to 2000 get_prism_annual(type = "tmean", year = 1990:2000, keepZip = FALSE) }  if (FALSE) { # get daily average temperature data for June 1 - 14, 2013 get_prism_dailys(   type = "tmean",    minDate = "2013-06-01",    maxDate = "2013-06-14",    keepZip=FALSE )  # get precipitation datat for June 1, 2013 get_prism_dailys(type = "ppt", dates = "2013/06/01", keepZip = FALSE)  # get average temperature for three specific days get_prism_dailys(   type="tmean",    dates = as.Date("2013-06-01", "2013-06-14", "2014-06-30"),    keepZip=FALSE )  # will fail: get_prism_dailys(   type = "ppt",    minDate = "2013-06-01",    dates = "2013-06-14",    keepZip = FALSE )  get_prism_dailys(   type = "ppt",    minDate = "2013-06-01",    keepZip=FALSE ) }  if (FALSE) { # Get all the precipitation data for January from 1990 to 2000 get_prism_monthlys(type = "ppt", years = 1990:2000, mon = 1, keepZip = FALSE)  # Get January-December 2005 monthly precipitation get_prism_monthlys(type = "ppt", years = 2005, mon = 1:12, keepZip = FALSE) }  if (FALSE) { # Get 30 year normal values for January rainfall get_prism_normals(type = "ppt", resolution = "4km", mon = 1, keepZip = FALSE)  # Get monthly (every month) and annual 30-year normals for mean temperature get_prism_normals(   type = "tmean",    resolution = "800m",    mon = 1:12,    annual = TRUE,   keepZip = FALSE ) }

title: Perform action on
text: pd_get_name() extracts long, human readable name prism data. pd_get_date() extracts date prism data. Date returned yyyy-mm-dd format. monthly data, dd 01 annual data mm also 01. normals, empty character returned. pd_get_type() parses variable prism data. prism_md() deprecated function replaced pd_get_name() pd_get_date() pd_to_file() converts prism data  fully specified .bil file, .e., full path file prism archive. warning posted file exist local prism archive.

title: Perform action on
code: pd_get_name(pd)  pd_get_date(pd)  pd_get_type(pd)  prism_md(f, returnDate = FALSE)  pd_to_file(pd)

title: Perform action on
text: pd prism data character vector. f 1 prism directories name .bil files. returnDate TRUE FALSE. TRUE, ISO date returned.  default years come back YYYY-01-01 months YYYY-MM-01

title: Perform action on
text: pd_get_name() pd_get_date() return character vector names/dates. pd_get_type() returns character vector prism variable types, e.g., 'ppt'. pd_to_file() returns character vector full path bil file.

title: Perform action on
text: "prism data", .e., pd folder names returned prism_archive_ls() prism_archive_subset(). functions get name date data, convert data file name.

title: Perform action on
code: if (FALSE) { # Assumes 2000-2002 annual precipitation data is already downloaded pd <- prism_archive_subset('ppt', 'annual', years = 2000:2002) pd_get_name(pd) ## [1] "2000 - 4km resolution - Precipitation" "2001 - 4km resolution - Precipitation" ## [3] "2002 - 4km resolution - Precipitation"  pd_get_date(pd) ## [1] "2000-01-01" "2001-01-01" "2002-01-01"  pd_get_type(pd) ## [1] "ppt" "ppt" "ppt"  pd_to_file(pd[1]) ## [1] "C:/prismdir/PRISM_ppt_stable_4kmM3_2000_bil/PRISM_ppt_stable_4kmM3_2000_bil.bil"" }

title: Get prism metadata — pd_get_md
text: Retrieves prism metadata specified prism data. "prism data", .e., pd folder names returned prism_archive_ls() prism_archive_subset(). functions get name date data, convert data file name. warning provided specified prism data exist archive.

title: Get prism metadata — pd_get_md
code: pd_get_md(pd)

title: Get prism metadata — pd_get_md
text: pd prism data character vector.

title: Get prism metadata — pd_get_md
text: data.frame containing metadata specified prism data.

title: Get prism metadata — pd_get_md
text: metadata includes following variables .info.txt file daily, monthly, annual data: PRISM_DATASET_FILENAME PRISM_DATASET_CREATE_DATE PRISM_DATASET_TYPE PRISM_DATASET_VERSION PRISM_CODE_VERSION PRISM_DATASET_REMARKS Additionally, two local variables added identifying file located local system: file_path folder_path annual monthly normals data includes different keys .info.txt, renamed found temporal data. keys/variables renamed follows: PRISM_FILENAME --> PRISM_DATASET_FILENAME PRISM_CREATE_DATE --> PRISM_DATASET_CREATE_DATE PRISM_DATASET --> PRISM_DATASET_TYPE PRISM_VERSION --> PRISM_CODE_VERSION PRISM_REMARKS --> PRISM_DATASET_REMARKS Additionally, normals include PRISM_DATASET_VERSION, variable added NA values.

title: Get prism metadata — pd_get_md
code: if (FALSE) { #' # Assumes 2000-2002 annual precipitation data is already downloaded pd <- prism_archive_subset('ppt', 'annual', years = 2000:2002) df <- pd_get_md(pd) head(df) }

title: Extract prism station metadata — pd_get_station_md
text: pd_get_station_md() extracts prism metadata stations used generate prism data. data must already downloaded available prism download folder. "prism data", .e., pd folder names returned prism_archive_ls() prism_archive_subset(). get_prism_station_md() deprecated version pd_get_station_md() works daily prism data.

title: Extract prism station metadata — pd_get_station_md
code: pd_get_station_md(pd)  get_prism_station_md(type, minDate = NULL, maxDate = NULL, dates = NULL)

title: Extract prism station metadata — pd_get_station_md
text: pd prism data character vector. type type data want subset. Must "ppt", "tmean", "tmin", "tmax", "tdmean", "vpdmin", "vpdmax". minDate Date start subsetting daily data. Must specified valid iso-8601 (e.g. YYYY-MM-DD) format. May provided either character base::Date class. maxDate Date end subsetting daily data.  Must specified valid iso-8601 (e.g. YYYY-MM-DD) format. May provided either character base::Date class. dates vector daily dates subset. Must specified valid iso-8601 (e.g. YYYY-MM-DD) format. May provided either character base::Date class.

title: Extract prism station metadata — pd_get_station_md
text: tbl_df containing metadata stations used specified day variable. data frame contains following columns: "date", "prism_data", "type", "station", "name", "longitude", "latitude", "elevation", "network", "stnid" "date" column character representation data. Monthly annual data given first day month, first month year reporting . Monthly annual normals empty strings.

title: Extract prism station metadata — pd_get_station_md
text: Note station metadata exist "tmean" type "annual" temporal periods. See prism_archive_subset() details specifying ranges dates different temporal periods.

title: Extract prism station metadata — pd_get_station_md
code: if (FALSE) { # download and then get meta data for January 1, 2010 precipitation get_prism_dailys("ppt", dates = "2010-01-01") pd <- prism_archive_subset("ppt", "daily", dates = "2010-01-01")  # will warn that 2010-01-02 is not found: pd_get_station_md(pd) }

what: prism: Access Data from the Oregon State Prism Climate Project — prism-package
title: prism: Access Data from the Oregon State Prism Climate Project — prism-package
text: Allows users access Oregon State Prism climate data (https://prism.nacse.org/). Using web service API data can easily downloaded bulk loaded R spatial analysis. user friendly visualizations also provided.

title: prism: Access Data from the Oregon State Prism Climate Project — prism-package
text: Maintainer: Alan Butler rabutler@usbr.gov (ORCID) [contributor] Authors: Hart Edmund Edmund.m.hart@gmail.com [conceptor] Kendon Bell kmb56@berkeley.edu

what: Clean the prism data by removing early and provisional data — prism_archive_clean
title: Clean the prism data by removing early and provisional data — prism_archive_clean
text: prism_archive_clean() 'cleans' prism download data removing early /provisional data newer (provisional stable) data also exist variable temporal period. Stable data newer provisional data newer early data; newest data kept "clean" performed. del_early_prov() deprecated version prism_archive_clean() works daily data, prompt user confirm folders removed.

title: Clean the prism data by removing early and provisional data — prism_archive_clean
code: prism_archive_clean(   type,   temp_period,   years = NULL,   mon = NULL,   minDate = NULL,   maxDate = NULL,   dates = NULL )  del_early_prov(type, minDate = NULL, maxDate = NULL, dates = NULL)

title: Clean the prism data by removing early and provisional data — prism_archive_clean
text: type type data want subset. Must "ppt", "tmean", "tmin", "tmax", "tdmean", "vpdmin", "vpdmax". temp_period temporal period subset. Must "annual", "monthly", "daily", "monthly normals", "annual normals". years Valid numeric year, vector years. mon Valid numeric month, vector months. minDate Date start subsetting daily data. Must specified valid iso-8601 (e.g. YYYY-MM-DD) format. May provided either character base::Date class. maxDate Date end subsetting daily data.  Must specified valid iso-8601 (e.g. YYYY-MM-DD) format. May provided either character base::Date class. dates vector daily dates subset. Must specified valid iso-8601 (e.g. YYYY-MM-DD) format. May provided either character base::Date class.

title: Clean the prism data by removing early and provisional data — prism_archive_clean
text: Invisibly returns vector deleted folders.

title: Clean the prism data by removing early and provisional data — prism_archive_clean
text: prism_archive_clean() prompts user verify folders removed R running interactive mode. Otherwise, data identified older newest available data removed. Daily data considered "early" current month. previous six months provisional data. six months data considered stable. Thus early data exist daily data, can monthly (presumably yearly) provisional data.

title: Clean the prism data by removing early and provisional data — prism_archive_clean
code: if (FALSE) { # delete any provisional annual precipitation data from 2000-2023 # del_files will containg any deleted files del_files <- prism_archive_clean('ppt', 'annual', 2000:2023) }

what: Subsets PRISM folders on the disk — prism_archive_subset
title: Subsets PRISM folders on the disk — prism_archive_subset
text: prism_archive_subset() subsets PRISM folders stored disk type, temporal period, date. looks PRISM data downloaded prism archive (prism_get_dl_dir()) returns subset based specified type, temp_period, dates.

title: Subsets PRISM folders on the disk — prism_archive_subset
code: prism_archive_subset(   type,   temp_period,   years = NULL,   mon = NULL,   minDate = NULL,   maxDate = NULL,   dates = NULL,   resolution = NULL )

title: Subsets PRISM folders on the disk — prism_archive_subset
text: type type data want subset. Must "ppt", "tmean", "tmin", "tmax", "tdmean", "vpdmin", "vpdmax". temp_period temporal period subset. Must "annual", "monthly", "daily", "monthly normals", "annual normals". years Valid numeric year, vector years. mon Valid numeric month, vector months. minDate Date start subsetting daily data. Must specified valid iso-8601 (e.g. YYYY-MM-DD) format. May provided either character base::Date class. maxDate Date end subsetting daily data.  Must specified valid iso-8601 (e.g. YYYY-MM-DD) format. May provided either character base::Date class. dates vector daily dates subset. Must specified valid iso-8601 (e.g. YYYY-MM-DD) format. May provided either character base::Date class. resolution spatial resolution data, must either "4km" "800m". specified temp_period "normals".

title: Subsets PRISM folders on the disk — prism_archive_subset
text: character vector folders meet type temporal period specified. character(0) returned folders found meet specifications.

title: Subsets PRISM folders on the disk — prism_archive_subset
text: temp_period must specified function can distinguish wanting annual data wanting monthly data specified year. example prism_archive_subset("tmean", "annual", years = 2012) provide one folder: annual average temperature 2012. However, prism_archive_subset("tmean", "monthly", years = 2012) provide 12 folders: monthly tmean folder 2012. temp_period, years, mon can combined various different ways obtain different groupings data. years, mon, daily specifiers (minDate/maxDate dates) optional. specifying result getting annual, monthly, daily data. minDate/maxDate dates specified temp_period "daily". Additionally, dates, minDate maxDate, specified, three specified. daily arguments combined years /mon. example, daily folders desired, specify years /mon get days years months specify specific dates using minDate/maxDate dates

title: Subsets PRISM folders on the disk — prism_archive_subset
code: if (FALSE) { # get all annual tmin prism_archive_subset("tmin", "annual") # get only 2000-2015 annual tmin prism_subset_folder("tmin", "annual", years = 2000-2015)  # get monthly precipitation for 2000-2010 prism_archive_subset("ppt", "monthly", years = 2000-2010) # get only June-August monthly precip data for 2000-2010 prism_archive_subset("ppt", "monthly", years = 2000-2010, mon = 6:8)  # get all daily tmax for July-August in 2010 prism_archive_subset("tmax", "daily", years = 2010, mon = 7:8) # same as: prism_archive_subset(   "tmax",    "daily",    minDate = "2010-07-01",    maxDate = "2010-08-31" )  # get the 4km 30-year average precip for January and February prism_archive_subset("ppt", "monthly normals", mon = 1:2, resolution = "4km") }

what: Check the integrity of downloaded PRISM data — prism_archive_verify

text: prism_archive_verify() checks data prism archive ensure valid, least can read R, .e., corrupt. prism variable type, time period, etc. specified prism_archive_subset(). files readable can automatically re-downloaded. check_corrupt() deprecated version prism_archive_verify()

title: Check the integrity of downloaded PRISM data — prism_archive_verify
code: prism_archive_verify(   type,   temp_period,   years = NULL,   mon = NULL,   minDate = NULL,   maxDate = NULL,   dates = NULL,   download_corrupt = TRUE,   keepZip = TRUE )  check_corrupt(type, minDate = NULL, maxDate = NULL, dates = NULL)

title: Check the integrity of downloaded PRISM data — prism_archive_verify
text: type type data want subset. Must "ppt", "tmean", "tmin", "tmax", "tdmean", "vpdmin", "vpdmax". temp_period temporal period subset. Must "annual", "monthly", "daily", "monthly normals", "annual normals". years Valid numeric year, vector years. mon Valid numeric month, vector months. minDate Date start subsetting daily data. Must specified valid iso-8601 (e.g. YYYY-MM-DD) format. May provided either character base::Date class. maxDate Date end subsetting daily data.  Must specified valid iso-8601 (e.g. YYYY-MM-DD) format. May provided either character base::Date class. dates vector daily dates subset. Must specified valid iso-8601 (e.g. YYYY-MM-DD) format. May provided either character base::Date class. download_corrupt TRUE, unreadable prism data automatically re-downloaded. keepZip TRUE, leave downloaded zip files 'prism.path', FALSE, deleted.

title: Check the integrity of downloaded PRISM data — prism_archive_verify
text: prism_archive_verify() returns TRUE data readable. prism data readable returned (folder names), whether re-downloaded . check_corrupt() returns logical indicating whether process succeeded.

title: Check the integrity of downloaded PRISM data — prism_archive_verify
text: hood, uses raster::stack() raster::rasterToPoints() determine bil files readable. files able successfully read files, assumed valid/readable.

title: Check the integrity of downloaded PRISM data — prism_archive_verify
code: if (FALSE) { # check all annual precipitation data from 2000-2023 are readable # x will contain any corrupt files, or be TRUE if they are all readable x <- prism_archive_verify('ppt', 'annual', 2000:2023) }

text: character vector file names yet downloaded logical vector indication yet downloaded.

title: prism 0.2.1.9000 (development version)
text: Removed global assignment inside prism_webservice() Documented return value pd_stack(), prism_set_dl_dir() ,pd_to_file(), pd_get_type() & get_prism_*() functions. Added examples documentation pd_to_file(), prism_archive_clean(), prism_archive_verify(), prism_set_dl_dir(), & pd_get_*() functions. Added better error message PRISM webservice (returning status 200). (#122)

title: prism 0.2.1
text: CRAN release: 2023-10-18 Released October 17, 2023

title: prism 0.2.1
text: Added service parameter get_prism_dailys(), get_prism_monthlys(), get_prism_annual(), user can provide subscription based URLs, instead default public available 4km data. (@adamlilith) mon now defaults 1:12, default now downloads months specified years years longer default NULL, user understand provided years longer default NULL, user understand provided Minor updates documentation mon years parameters

title: prism 0.2.1
text: Removed LazyData LazyLoad Description fix CRAN note. Removed lubridate imports fix CRAN note. Removed vignette depended many libraries; want add Suggests also relied external shape file. may linked README future. Updated error message pd_image() input length 0. Fixed documentation get_prism_normals() reference new period (1991-2020). (#111) Updated error message get_prism_dailys() date Jan. 1, 1981 provided. Deprecated check parameter get_prism_dailys() exist monthly annual functions. (#116) Removed purrr imports switching one call purrr:map() lapply().

title: prism 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-12-05 Published December 5, 2020 Thanks @jsta updating README helping several hood fixes.

title: prism 0.2.0
text: prism_webservice() longer exported wrapped get_prism_*() functions, requires correctly specified url. can still called prism:::prism_webservice() users really need . (#83) pr_parse() longer exported. Use pd_get_name() pd_get_date() instead.

title: prism 0.2.0
text: two overall major updates release. (1) functions work temporal periods variables; previously functions worked daily data variables able downloaded prism website. (2) new API implemented results many functions deprecated favor updated naming convention. change intended provide consistent names functions apply different steps work flow implemented package. details changes : Users can now download vpdmin, vpdmax, tdmean variables 30-year normals, daily, monthly, annual data. (#68) prism_check_dl_dir() replaces check_path(), deprecated removed next release. New function: prism_archive_subset(). makes much easier get data specific type/temporal period prism archive. (#69) return type options changed ls_prism_data() prism_archive_ls(), now always returns folder names vector, instead data.frame 1 3 columns. previous behavior can achieved applying new functions (pd_get_name() pd_to_file()) vector returned prism_archive_ls(). prism_archive_clean() replaces del_early_prov(), removed future release. also now works time steps prompts user select folders removed removing (R interactive mode). (#89) prism_archive_verify() replaces check_corrupt(), removed future release. also now works time steps daily gains download_corrupt argument controls whether corrupt files automatically re-downloaded. pd_image() replaces prism_image(). pd_plot_slice() replaces prism_slice(). pd_stack() replaces prism_stack(). pd_get_station_md() replaces get_prism_station_md(). (#88) pd_get_name(), equivalent prism_md(f, FALSE). pd_get_date(), equivalent prism_md(f, TRUE). Two new functions added convert prism data full absolute path (pd_to_file()) get type (parameter) prism data (pd_get_type()).

title: prism 0.2.0
text: get_prism_annual() get_prism_monthlys() gain keep_pre81_months parameter. lets user determine monthly annual data kept, since download includes 12 months + annual data years 1981. TRUE monthly data kept, instead specified current call get_prism_*(). (#82) pre-1981 data might already downloaded based keep_pre81_months parameter previous downloads, download functions now check pre-1981 data exist downloading . , prism_webservice() prism_check() gain pre81_months parameter, allows functions know months requested downloading. (#81) prism web service allows user download data twice 24-hour period. download functions now report user exceeded allowable number attempts download file (one day). user tries download file two times one day, message posted warning returned text file saved prism archive. posted error query multiple files runs issue, abort full query. Another warning posts unzipped folder empty. (#80) prism_check() deprecated longer exported next release. get_prism_normals() now error neither monthly annual data specified downloaded download monthly annual data simultaneously asked . (#77) get_prism_*() functions documented help page. (#79) Help pages non-exported functions removed. tests added. 50% coverage now. tests run locally ensure prism download limits exceeded. pd_get_station_md() (formerly get_prism_station_md()) now reports warning requested dates exist metadata data frame. (#87 related). also now works monthly normals; solely daily prism data. pd_get_md() added parse .info.txt metadata, converting existing internal function. (#88) prism_archive_clean() (formerly del_early_prov()) now invisibly returns folders removes. pd_image() (formerly prism_image()) invisibly returns gg object creates. also shows units prism variable fill legend. (#99)

title: prism 0.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2018-12-10

title: prism 0.1.0
text: del_early_prov() searches download folder duplicated PRISM data keeps newest version. get_prism_station_md() extracts metadata daily PRISM data. get_prism_dailys() gains check parameter allows user specify prism files checked.

title: prism 0.1.0
text: get_prism_monthlys() can now download 1981 data. (@sdtaylor #59, #63) get_prism_annual() can now download pre 1981 data . (@rabutler #64) get_prism_dailys() now correctly sets progress bar. fixed bug gen_dates() get_prism_dailys() works dates parameter specified. (@rabutler #66)

title: prism 0.1.0
text: added internal gen_dates() function determining specified dates (either minDate maxDate. dates) used get_prism_*() functions. added tests gen_dates() .

title: prism 0.0.7
text: CRAN release: 2015-11-16

title: prism 0.0.7
text: Changed acquisition method use prism webservice. Prior change FTP acquisition method often caused server time download request volume became high. Changed method metadata extraction. Originally parsed XML metadata get information raster files. However XML historical data particularly sparse. new method relies parsing file names instead. universal, may less stable

title: prism 0.0.7
text: Fixed FTP time error switching webservice Fixed prism_stack adjusting new metadata extraction method
